meanings.definition: To have the sensation of being similar to something else.
meanings.sent1: When I touched the soft blanket, it feltlike a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent2: The new fabric feltlike silk against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's fur feltlike a cozy sweater.
meanings.sent4: The music feltlike a warm embrace to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The warm sand feltlike a soft carpet under my feet.

meanings.definition: To have the sensation of being a certain way.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, my legs feltlike jelly.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind made my cheeks feltlike ice.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news feltlike a bucket of cold water on my head.
meanings.sent4: His words feltlike a sharp knife piercing through my heart.
meanings.sent5: The excitement before the concert feltlike fireworks in my chest.
